title: In Seized Parts of Ukraine, Moscow Stages Balloting on Joining Russia
description: Under coercive conditions, with most residents gone and war still raging, Russia is putting on what it calls referendums on annexation but Ukraine and its allies call an illegal farce.

title: Putin’s Draft Draws Resistance in Russia’s Far-Flung Regions
description: Villagers, activists and some elected officials asked why the conscription drive seemed to be hitting poor, remote areas hardest, while pro-war hawks criticized it as chaotic.

title: Hilary Mantel Stared Down Her Past, and the World’s, With Steely Resolve
description: Hilary Mantel brought great precision to her writing, and asked the same of us in our reading.

title: Referendums in Russian-occupied Ukraine evoke fear, anger and defiance.
Group of 7 countries condemn ‘sham’ referendums in Ukraine.
Russian aviation scientist dies, adding to a series of suspicious deaths.
Berlusconi Draws Backlash for Saying Putin Was ‘Pushed’ to Invade Ukraine
description: Italy’s former prime minister said that the Russian president was “pushed” to invade Ukraine, remarks that drew fierce criticism days before an election.

title: Major Covid Holdouts in Asia Drop Border Restrictions
description: Hong Kong, Taiwan and Japan have relaxed their pandemic rules, as they look to bolster their economies and play catch-up with much of the world.

title: Church of England Stops Desmond Tutu’s Daughter From Officiating Funeral
description: Rev. Mpho Tutu van Furth, an Episcopal priest who is married to a woman, said the funeral of her godfather was moved to his garden to allow her to participate.

title: Is Little Amal Getting Lost in New York?
description: The hottest celebrity in town right now is an enchanting 12-foot-tall Syrian refugee puppet. She’s drawing masses of admirers, but that’s not always a good thing.

title: The referendums are taking place in areas from which large numbers of people have fled.
Russia Begins Staged Referendums In Occupied Areas of Ukraine
description: Huge numbers of people have fled the areas that Russia controls, the process has been rushed and referendums are taking place against a backdrop of oppression.

title: Dozens of Migrants Feared Dead After Boat Capsizes Off Syria
description: Witnesses said that bodies could be seen from shore drifting in the waters just outside the port of Tartus. The Lebanese authorities said at least 75 people died, with 20 rescued.

title: Poundbury, England: The Town That Charles Built
description: Before King Charles III inherited Britain’s throne, he was a prince with strong views on architecture. Poundbury is where he tried to put them into practice.

title: On a Corpse’s Wrist, an Emblem of Ukrainian Fortitude
description: When they pulled Serhiy Sova’s body from a grave in Izium, his wrist bore a bracelet in Ukraine’s colors, given to him by his children. The image has transfixed the nation.

title: Abel Selaocoe Finds a Home in Improvisation
description: The classically trained South African cellist draws on musical traditions from across the globe for his debut album, “Where is Home (Hae Ke Kae).”

title: How A South African Town Became Buried in Sludge After A Diamond Mine Collapse
description: Waste from a diamond mine in South Africa grew ever higher as the ownership changed from De Beers to a billionaire to a Dubai-based retailer. The mining town paid the price.

title: War Crimes Have Been Committed in Ukraine, U.N. Experts Say
description: In an unusually hard-hitting statement, the panel of experts laid out graphic allegations of rape and torture.

title: What You Need to Know About the Elections in Italy
description: The elections could produce the first government led by a woman and by a hard-right party with post-Fascist roots.

title: Some Women Fear Giorgia Meloni’s Far-Right Agenda Will Set Italy Back
description: Some fear that the hard-right politician, whose party is expected to be the big winner in the election on Sunday, will continue policies that have kept women back.

title: When Whales Are Stranded, a Race Against Time Begins
description: After 230 pilot whales were stranded on the western coast of Tasmania, a scramble started almost immediately to save as many as possible.

title: Russia Begins Orchestrating Staged Voting in Occupied Territories
description: The plans for referendums on becoming part of Russia were met with international condemnation. The process is expected to culminate with the annexation of an area larger than Portugal.

title: A Shift in Crime
description: Murders are declining, but other crimes are still disrupting American life.

title: U.K. Government Goes Full Tilt on Tax Cuts and Free-Market Economics
description: The new administration’s proposals are a sharp break from the era of Boris Johnson, and they represent a turn toward Thatcherism.

title: In Myanmar, Grief and Fury After an Attack on a School
description: Eleven children died when soldiers fired on the school, where they said rebels had taken cover. “This is a war crime,” said a U.N. expert.

title: The World Got Diamonds. A Mining Town Got Buried in Sludge.
description: Waste from a diamond mine in South Africa grew ever higher as the ownership changed from De Beers to a billionaire to a Dubai-based retailer. The mining town paid the price.

title: Major Covid Holdouts in Asia Drop Border Restrictions
description: Hong Kong, Taiwan and Japan have relaxed their pandemic rules, as they look to bolster their economies and play catch-up with much of the world.

title: Winter is coming, windows are shattered, and Ukraine is running short on glass.
In Melbourne, a Sky-High Drama Takes Hold
description: Peregrine falcons nesting in the city’s financial district offer riveting theater every day with their daily life, including sex, death and high-speed chases.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Interest rate hikes around the world.
